``` python
    conda_type:Annotated=None
)->None:

```

*CJM Plugin System CLI for managing isolated plugin environments.*

## Setup Runtime

The `setup-runtime` command downloads and installs micromamba for
project-local mode. This is required before running `install-all` when
using `conda_type: micromamba` in the configuration.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

<a
href="https://github.com/cj-mills/cjm-plugin-system/blob/main/cjm_plugin_system/cli.py#L62"
target="_blank" style="float:right; font-size:smaller">source</a>

### setup_runtime

``` python

def setup_runtime(
    force:bool=<typer.models.OptionInfo object at 0x7fb94ed23e60>
)->None:

```

*Download and setup micromamba runtime for project-local mode.*

------------------------------------------------------------------------

<a
href="https://github.com/cj-mills/cjm-plugin-system/blob/main/cjm_plugin_system/cli.py#L178"
target="_blank" style="float:right; font-size:smaller">source</a>

### run_cmd

``` python

def run_cmd(
    cmd:str, # Shell command to execute
    check:bool=True, # Whether to raise on non-zero exit
)->None:

```

*Run a shell command and stream output.*

Uses the platform’s default shell (no hardcoded /bin/bash).

------------------------------------------------------------------------

<a
href="https://github.com/cj-mills/cjm-plugin-system/blob/main/cjm_plugin_system/cli.py#L386"
target="_blank" style="float:right; font-size:smaller">source</a>

### install_all

``` python

def install_all(
    plugins_path:str=<typer.models.OptionInfo object at 0x7fb94ed3c1a0>,
    force:bool=<typer.models.OptionInfo object at 0x7fb94ed3c230>
)->None:

```

*Install and register all plugins defined in plugins.yaml.*

## Setup Host Environment

The `setup-host` command prepares the host application’s Python
environment by installing all unique interface libraries referenced in
`plugins.yaml`. This is separate from `install-all` which sets up
isolated plugin environments.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

<a
href="https://github.com/cj-mills/cjm-plugin-system/blob/main/cjm_plugin_system/cli.py#L496"
target="_blank" style="float:right; font-size:smaller">source</a>

### setup_host

``` python

def setup_host(
    plugins_path:str=<typer.models.OptionInfo object at 0x7fb94ed3f470>,
    yes:bool=<typer.models.OptionInfo object at 0x7fb94ed3f230>
)->None:

```

*Install interface libraries in the current Python environment.*

## Estimate Disk Space

The `estimate-size` command estimates the disk space required for plugin
environments before installation. It uses conda’s dry-run feature for
accurate conda package sizes and queries PyPI for pip package sizes.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

<a
href="https://github.com/cj-mills/cjm-plugin-system/blob/main/cjm_plugin_system/cli.py#L663"
target="_blank" style="float:right; font-size:smaller">source</a>

### estimate_size

``` python

def estimate_size(
    plugins_path:str=<typer.models.OptionInfo object at 0x7fb94ed08050>,
    plugin_name:Optional=<typer.models.OptionInfo object at 0x7fb94ed0a660>,
    verbose:bool=<typer.models.OptionInfo object at 0x7fb94ed0b4d0>
)->None:

```

*Estimate disk space required for plugin environments.*

## List Plugins

The `list` command shows installed plugins by scanning manifest files in
the configured manifests directory (defaults to `~/.cjm/manifests/`). It
can optionally cross-reference with a plugins.yaml file and check conda
environment status.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

<a
href="https://github.com/cj-mills/cjm-plugin-system/blob/main/cjm_plugin_system/cli.py#L825"
target="_blank" style="float:right; font-size:smaller">source</a>

### list_plugins

``` python

def list_plugins(
    plugins_path:Optional=<typer.models.OptionInfo object at 0x7fb94ed3d940>,
    show_envs:bool=<typer.models.OptionInfo object at 0x7fb94ed3caa0>
)->None:

```

*List installed plugins from manifest directory.*

## Remove Plugin

The `remove` command removes a plugin’s manifest and optionally its
conda environment. It can look up the environment name from the manifest
or a config file.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

<a
href="https://github.com/cj-mills/cjm-plugin-system/blob/main/cjm_plugin_system/cli.py#L884"
target="_blank" style="float:right; font-size:smaller">source</a>

### remove_plugin

``` python

def remove_plugin(
    plugin_name:str=<typer.models.ArgumentInfo object at 0x7fb94ed09a60>,
    plugins_path:Optional=<typer.models.OptionInfo object at 0x7fb94ed0a450>,
    keep_env:bool=<typer.models.OptionInfo object at 0x7fb94ed3ce00>,
    yes:bool=<typer.models.OptionInfo object at 0x7fb94ed3f4a0>
)->None:

```

*Remove a plugin’s manifest and conda environment.*
